channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Learning to Visually Localize Sound Sources from Mixtures without Prior Source Knowledge
item.description: In this paper, to overcome this limitation, we present a novel multi-sound source localization method that can perform localization without prior knowledge of the number of sound sources.

item.title: Are Compressed Language Models Less Subgroup Robust?
item.description: To reduce the inference cost of large language models, model compression is increasingly used to create smaller scalable models.

item.title: PlainMamba: Improving Non-Hierarchical Mamba in Visual Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we further adapt the selective scanning process of Mamba to the visual domain, enhancing its ability to learn features from two-dimensional images by (i) a continuous 2D scanning process that improves spatial continuity by ensuring adjacency of tokens in the scanning sequence, and (ii) direction-aware updating which enables the model to discern the spatial relations of tokens by encoding directional information.

item.title: Empowering Data Mesh with Federated Learning
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first open-source applied work that represents a critical advancement toward the integration of federated learning methods into the Data Mesh paradigm, underscoring the promising prospects for privacy-preserving and decentralized data analysis strategies within Data Mesh architecture.

item.title: MESIA: Understanding and Leveraging Supplementary Nature of Method-level Comments for Automatic Comment Generation
item.description: In this paper, we raise the awareness of the supplementary nature of method-level comments and propose a new metric named MESIA (Mean Supplementary Information Amount) to assess the extent of supplementary information that a code comment can provide.

item.title: LASIL: Learner-Aware Supervised Imitation Learning For Long-term Microscopic Traffic Simulation
item.description: Due to the covariate shift issue, existing imitation learning-based simulators often fail to generate stable long-term simulations.

item.title: Efficient Image Pre-Training with Siamese Cropped Masked Autoencoders
item.description: In particular, SiamMAE recently introduced a Siamese network, training a shared-weight encoder from two frames of a video with a high asymmetric masking ratio (95%).

item.title: Intrinsic Subgraph Generation for Interpretable Graph based Visual Question Answering
item.description: In this work, we introduce an interpretable approach for graph-based VQA and demonstrate competitive performance on the GQA dataset.

item.title: ILLUMINER: Instruction-tuned Large Language Models as Few-shot Intent Classifier and Slot Filler
item.description: State-of-the-art intent classification (IC) and slot filling (SF) methods often rely on data-intensive deep learning models, limiting their practicality for industry applications.

item.title: Activity-Biometrics: Person Identification from Daily Activities
item.description: Furthermore, we extensively compare ABNet with existing works in person identification and demonstrate its effectiveness for activity-based biometrics across all five datasets.

item.title: SGHormer: An Energy-Saving Graph Transformer Driven by Spikes
item.description: However, the costs behind outstanding performances of GTs are higher energy consumption and computational overhead.

item.title: AID: Attention Interpolation of Text-to-Image Diffusion
item.description: To that end, we introduce a novel training-free technique named Attention Interpolation via Diffusion (AID).

item.title: Can multiple-choice questions really be useful in detecting the abilities of LLMs?
item.description: Additionally, we propose two methods to quantify the consistency and confidence of LLMs' output, which can be generalized to other QA evaluation benchmarks.

item.title: Task-Oriented Paraphrase Analytics
item.description: Since paraphrasing is an ill-defined task, the term "paraphrasing" covers text transformation tasks with different characteristics.

item.title: MIND Your Language: A Multilingual Dataset for Cross-lingual News Recommendation
item.description: Our findings reveal that (i) current NNRs, even when based on a multilingual language model, suffer from substantial performance losses under ZS-XLT and that (ii) inclusion of target-language data in FS-XLT training has limited benefits, particularly when combined with a bilingual news consumption.

item.title: Continual Few-shot Event Detection via Hierarchical Augmentation Networks
item.description: The CFED task is challenging as it involves memorizing previous event types and learning new event types with few-shot samples.

item.title: DGoT: Dynamic Graph of Thoughts for Scientific Abstract Generation
item.description: However, due to the hallucination problem of LLM, it is often necessary to improve the reliability of the results through multi-round query prompt approach such as Graph of Thoughts (GoT), which also brings additional reasoning costs.

item.title: Physical 3D Adversarial Attacks against Monocular Depth Estimation in Autonomous Driving
item.description: Deep learning-based monocular depth estimation (MDE), extensively applied in autonomous driving, is known to be vulnerable to adversarial attacks.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Training ID-Agnostic Multi-modal Sequential Recommenders
item.description: Sequential Recommendation (SR) aims to predict future user-item interactions based on historical interactions.

item.title: Learning the Optimal Power Flow: Environment Design Matters
item.description: Further, we derive some first recommendations regarding the choice of these design decisions.

item.title: A Gaze-grounded Visual Question Answering Dataset for Clarifying Ambiguous Japanese Questions
item.description: Such ambiguities in questions are often clarified by the contexts in conversational situations, such as joint attention with a user or user gaze information.

item.title: ELGC-Net: Efficient Local-Global Context Aggregation for Remote Sensing Change Detection
item.description: Deep learning has shown remarkable success in remote sensing change detection (CD), aiming to identify semantic change regions between co-registered satellite image pairs acquired at distinct time stamps.

item.title: Incorporating Exponential Smoothing into MLP: A Simple but Effective Sequence Model
item.description: Modeling long-range dependencies in sequential data is a crucial step in sequence learning.

item.title: ELLEN: Extremely Lightly Supervised Learning For Efficient Named Entity Recognition
item.description: In a zero-shot setting, ELLEN also achieves over 75% of the performance of a strong, fully supervised model trained on gold data.

item.title: Groupwise Query Specialization and Quality-Aware Multi-Assignment for Transformer-based Visual Relationship Detection
item.description: Groupwise Query Specialization trains a specialized query by dividing queries and relations into disjoint groups and directing a query in a specific query group solely toward relations in the corresponding relation group.

item.title: Building Bridges across Spatial and Temporal Resolutions: Reference-Based Super-Resolution via Change Priors and Conditional Diffusion Model
item.description: Specifically, we inject the priors into the denoising model to improve the utilization of reference information in unchanged areas and regulate the reconstruction of semantically relevant content in changed areas.

item.title: ArabicaQA: A Comprehensive Dataset for Arabic Question Answering
item.description: In conclusion, ArabicaQA, AraDPR, and the benchmarking of LLMs in Arabic question answering offer significant advancements in the field of Arabic NLP.

item.title: DS-AL: A Dual-Stream Analytic Learning for Exemplar-Free Class-Incremental Learning
item.description: The compensation stream is governed by a Dual-Activation Compensation (DAC) module.

item.title: Neural Multimodal Topic Modeling: A Comprehensive Evaluation
item.description: This paper presents the first systematic and comprehensive evaluation of multimodal topic modeling of documents containing both text and images.

item.title: Bridging Textual and Tabular Worlds for Fact Verification: A Lightweight, Attention-Based Model
item.description: FEVEROUS is a benchmark and research initiative focused on fact extraction and verification tasks involving unstructured text and structured tabular data.

item.title: Robust and Scalable Model Editing for Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) can make predictions using parametric knowledge--knowledge encoded in the model weights--or contextual knowledge--knowledge presented in the context.

item.title: JMultiWOZ: A Large-Scale Japanese Multi-Domain Task-Oriented Dialogue Dataset
item.description: In this study, towards the advancement of research and development of task-oriented dialogue systems in Japanese, we constructed JMultiWOZ, the first Japanese language large-scale multi-domain task-oriented dialogue dataset.

item.title: The Need for Speed: Pruning Transformers with One Recipe
item.description: We introduce the $\textbf{O}$ne-shot $\textbf{P}$runing $\textbf{T}$echnique for $\textbf{I}$nterchangeable $\textbf{N}$etworks ($\textbf{OPTIN}$) framework as a tool to increase the efficiency of pre-trained transformer architectures $\textit{without requiring re-training}$.

item.title: Language Models are Free Boosters for Biomedical Imaging Tasks
item.description: In this study, we uncover the unexpected efficacy of residual-based large language models (LLMs) as part of encoders for biomedical imaging tasks, a domain traditionally devoid of language or textual data.

item.title: Fully-fused Multi-Layer Perceptrons on Intel Data Center GPUs
item.description: We compare our approach to a similar CUDA implementation for MLPs and show that our implementation on the Intel Data Center GPU outperforms the CUDA implementation on Nvidia's H100 GPU by a factor up to 2. 84 in inference and 1. 75 in training.

item.title: Dual Memory Networks: A Versatile Adaptation Approach for Vision-Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a versatile adaptation approach that can effectively work under all three settings.

item.title: PCToolkit: A Unified Plug-and-Play Prompt Compression Toolkit of Large Language Models
item.description: Prompt compression is an innovative method for efficiently condensing input prompts while preserving essential information.

item.title: S+t-SNE - Bringing dimensionality reduction to data streams
item.description: We present S+t-SNE, an adaptation of the t-SNE algorithm designed to handle infinite data streams.

item.title: TWOLAR: a TWO-step LLM-Augmented distillation method for passage Reranking
item.description: In this paper, we present TWOLAR: a two-stage pipeline for passage reranking based on the distillation of knowledge from Large Language Models (LLM).

item.title: KDMCSE: Knowledge Distillation Multimodal Sentence Embeddings with Adaptive Angular margin Contrastive Learning
item.description: Previous work on multimodal sentence embedding has proposed multimodal contrastive learning and achieved promising results.

item.title: ChroniclingAmericaQA: A Large-scale Question Answering Dataset based on Historical American Newspaper Pages
item.description: Therefore, to enable realistic testing of QA models, our dataset can be used in three different ways: answering questions from raw and noisy content, answering questions from cleaner, corrected version of the content, as well as answering questions from scanned images of newspaper pages.

item.title: Self-Rectifying Diffusion Sampling with Perturbed-Attention Guidance
item.description: These techniques are often not applicable in unconditional generation or in various downstream tasks such as image restoration.

item.title: Efficient Video Object Segmentation via Modulated Cross-Attention Memory
item.description: Recently, transformer-based approaches have shown promising results for semi-supervised video object segmentation.

item.title: Sharing the Cost of Success: A Game for Evaluating and Learning Collaborative Multi-Agent Instruction Giving and Following Policies
item.description: In collaborative goal-oriented settings, the participants are not only interested in achieving a successful outcome, but do also implicitly negotiate the effort they put into the interaction (by adapting to each other).

item.title: Scenario-Based Curriculum Generation for Multi-Agent Autonomous Driving
item.description: Especially in real-world application domains, such as autonomous driving, auto-curriculum generation is considered vital for obtaining robust and general policies.

item.title: OmniVid: A Generative Framework for Universal Video Understanding
item.description: The core of video understanding tasks, such as recognition, captioning, and tracking, is to automatically detect objects or actions in a video and analyze their temporal evolution.

item.title: HILL: Hierarchy-aware Information Lossless Contrastive Learning for Hierarchical Text Classification
item.description: Existing self-supervised methods in natural language processing (NLP), especially hierarchical text classification (HTC), mainly focus on self-supervised contrastive learning, extremely relying on human-designed augmentation rules to generate contrastive samples, which can potentially corrupt or distort the original information.

item.title: Deepfake Generation and Detection: A Benchmark and Survey
item.description: In addition to the advancements in deepfake generation, corresponding detection technologies need to continuously evolve to regulate the potential misuse of deepfakes, such as for privacy invasion and phishing attacks.

item.title: A foundation model utilizing chest CT volumes and radiology reports for supervised-level zero-shot detection of abnormalities
item.description: A major challenge in computational research in 3D medical imaging is the lack of comprehensive datasets.

item.title: REFeREE: A REference-FREE Model-Based Metric for Text Simplification
item.description: Text simplification lacks a universal standard of quality, and annotated reference simplifications are scarce and costly.
